headline: 2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
description: The Winter Olympics, which begin on Friday, promise a spectacle of athletic achievement, emotion and entertainment broadcast worldwide. Yet its organizers must now prove that their dispersed venue model is viable.

headline: French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
Jean-Luc Mélenchon courts small business owners
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
description: According to Paris, the Syrian authorities' agreement with Kurdish forces challenges the structure of the fight against the jihadist group in Syria and Iraq. On Thursday, France's foreign minister traveled to Damascus, Baghdad and Erbil.

headline: French judge and her mother freed after a cryptocurrency-linked abduction
description: The two women were kidnapped on Wednesday night. The judge's partner is an active investor in the cryptocurrency sector.

headline: Six Nations: France holds promises with decisive victory against Ireland
description: The French, buoyed by the return of Antoine Dupont, convincingly defeated the Irish at the Stade de France (36-14). They have launched their title defense with panache.

headline: UK inquiry further incriminates French rescue services in 2021 Channel shipwreck
description: The findings of a British public inquiry reveal that French rescue services on November 24, 2021, instructed an oil tanker to continue its course, even though it was likely the ship had located the distressed dinghy in which 31 people perished.

headline: France detects Russia-linked Epstein smear attempt against Macron, says government source
EU tells TikTok to change its 'addictive' design or face fines
Canada, France open consulates in Greenland in show of support
Suspected former member of the Kosovo Liberation Army arrested for war crimes
Kimi Onoda, Japan's young minister likened to 'Joan of Arc,' courts the conservative electorate
Pretzels and Käseküeche: The comforting treasures of Alsatian cuisine
Ahmed Yousef, former Hamas official: 'We have lost everything, armed struggle has failed'
How Marine Le Pen changed her defense strategy
Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry
Iran's participation in BRICS+ naval drills against South Africa's wishes causes confusion
Lore Baudrit, captain of France's Olympic women's hockey team: 'We train like pros, but don't get paid'
European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
description: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

headline: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
description: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

headline: Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
description: Millions of emails released by the US Department of Justice reveal the financier's relationships, some more intense than others, with several figures from France's politics and culture.

headline: The US versus human rights
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
'The US always promises to extract itself from Middle Eastern quagmires while continuing to get stuck knee-deep'
